Recipe.Title: Hamburger Steak
Recipe.RecipeIntroduction: An easy-to-make classic featuring tasty hamburger 'steaks' smothered in gravy and onions. Traditionally served with hot white rice or potatoes, it's a great way to dress up a pound of ground beef and you probably have all the ingredients on hand!

ToolTip.Text: THIS WILL BE FOR MEDIUM HEAT IN STEP Cook 1 - TODO

Browning means to cook the surface of meat, which results in a brown colour. Note that this does not necessarily mean the meat is cooked - In most cases it will be further cooked with other ingredients!
THIS WILL BE FOR MEDIUM-LOW HEAT IN STEP Cook 1 - TODO

RecipeStep.StepText: In a large bowl, mix together 1 pound ground beef, 1 egg, 1/4 Cup bread crumbs, 1/8 tsp pepper, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp onion powder, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, and 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce. Form into 8 balls, and flatten into patties.
RecipeStep.Title: Make Beef Mixture

RecipeStep.StepText: Heat 1 tbsp. oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the patties and onion in the oil until patties are nicely browned, about 4 minutes per side. Remove the beef patties to a plate, and keep warm.
RecipeStep.Title: Fry Steak Patties

RecipeStep.StepText: Sprinkle 2 tbsp. flour over the onions and drippings in the skillet. Stir in flour with a fork, scraping bits of beef off of the bottom as you stir. Gradually mix in the 1 cup beef broth and 1 tbsp. sherry. Season with 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt. Simmer and stir over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes, until the gravy thickens. Turn heat to low, return patties to the gravy, cover, and simmer for another 15 minutes.
RecipeStep.Title: Fry Steak Patties & Make Gravy
